item.title: Zero's Garden
item.description: Welcome to my digital garden, where I keep notes of my thoughts and knowledge about topics I‚Äôm intretested in like computer science. Notes are loosely grouped into topics and interconnected, and there is no strict hierarchy.

item.title: AI Tools
item.description: Chatbots ¬ß ChatGPT Coding Assistant ¬ß GitHub Copilot Amazon CodeWhisperer Models ¬ß LLM Models Toolkit ¬ß LangChain .

item.title: ChatGPT
item.description: Self-hosted Web UI ¬ß ChatGPT-Next-Web Derivatives ¬ß New Bing Poe Forefront Chat .

item.title: Forefront Chat
item.description: www.forefront.ai Forefront chat provides free access to GPT-4 for now.

item.title: GPT-4 Chat Demo
item.description: Warning The chat was saved to demostrate how to ask GPT-4 questions and provide hints. The formula may be incorrect. Chat Text ¬ß Could you estimate the average time a TCP request waits in the surge queue of an AWS CLB from CloudWatch metrics? ¬ß To estimate the average time a TCP request waits in the surge queue of an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Classic Load Balancer (CLB), you can use the SurgeQueueLength and RequestCount metrics from Amazon CloudWatch.

item.title: LLM Models
item.description: Commercial Models ¬ß GPT-4 GPT-3.5 Open Source Models ¬ß Dolly StableLM .

item.title: New Bing
item.description: Based on GPT-4, New Bing is free to use but has a limit of 5 turns per session for unregistered users. New Bing can be accessed from the Edge browser or the Bing app on mobile.

item.title: Poe
item.description: poe.com Poe is a platform that enables users to access third-party chatbots, including ChatGPT. Poe can give suggestions on further questions the user could ask, and highlights terms that could be explained further by clicking on them.

item.title: Here Document
item.description: Parameter expansion ¬ß Quote the word in here-documents to inhibit any expansion. <<'word' If any part of word is quoted, the delimiter is the result of quote removal on word, and the lines in the here-document are not expanded.

item.title: Line Editing
item.description: Read man 3 readline for more information.

item.title: Convenient CLI Tools
item.description: dog (DNS resolution) xhs, xh (HTTP/S request) fd (find) rg (grep) pv (pipe viewer) dug (DNS propagation checker) ffsend (share files securely) age (simple file encryption tool) restic (file backup tool) rclone (rsync for cloud) namei (check parent directory permissions) ncdu (TUI disk usage analyzer) lft (Layer Four Traceroute) .

item.title: Removing Auto-Inserted Comment Leader
item.description: After pressing Enter or ‚Äòo‚Äô, use CTRL-U to remove the comment leader. See :help fo-table. o Automatically insert the current comment leader after hitting 'o' or 'O' in Normal mode.

item.title: Word Splitting
item.description: Use $=VAR instead of $VAR to force parameter expansions to be split into separate words before substitution, using IFS as a delimiter. This is done by default in most other shells.

item.title: curl
item.description: ‚Äîconnect-to ¬ß Syntax: --connect-to <HOST1:PORT1:HOST2:PORT2> ‚ÄúHOST1‚Äù and ‚ÄúPORT1‚Äù may be the empty string, meaning ‚Äúany host/port‚Äù. ‚ÄúHOST2‚Äù and ‚ÄúPORT2‚Äù may also be the empty string, meaning ‚Äúuse the request‚Äôs original host/port‚Äù.

item.title: ffmpeg
item.description: One-Liners ¬ß Detect encoding errors ¬ß ffmpeg -err_detect explode -i <infile> -f null - Convert music file to Opus format ¬ß find . -type f -name '*.

item.title: git-status
item.description: git status taking too long ¬ß May affect interactivity of shell prompts (e.g. starship) that check git status. To reduce prompt latency, disable checking untracked files in big repositories.

item.title: journalctl
item.description: Useful Options ¬ß -b (show logs from the current boot only) -e (jump to end in pager mode) -x (augment log lines with catalog info, don't use for bug reports) .

item.title: less
item.description: Do not clear the screen on exit ¬ß -X or --no-init Disables sending the termcap initialization and deinitialization strings to the terminal. This is sometimes desirable if the deinitialization string does something unnecessary, like clear- ing the screen.

item.title: lsof
item.description: List open files and sockets. On FreeBSD, use procstat instead.

item.title: namei
item.description: namei -om displays permissions follows each pathname and prints their modes and owners.

item.title: nstat
item.description: nstat is part of the iproute2 collection, replacing the old netstat --statistics command.

item.title: procstat
item.description: On FreeBSD, use procstat -f <PID> to list open files and sockets.

item.title: systemd-analyze
item.description: Subcommands ¬ß time: analyze startup time set-log-level: set systemd log level .

item.title: zfs
item.description: Snapshots ¬ß # Create snapshot zfs snap <volume>@<snapshot_name> # Delete snapshot (dry-run) zfs destroy -vn <volume>@<snapshot_name> # List snapshots zfs list -t snapshot.

item.title: Aurora MySQL
item.description: JDBC Drivers ¬ß MariaDB Connector/J ¬ß #failover-and-load-balancing-modes ModeDescriptionauroraThis mode supports connection failover in an Amazon Aurora cluster.

item.title: Availability Zones
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß Map Availability Zones across accounts ¬ß Availability Zone names don‚Äôt map to the same location across accounts. However, you can use AZ IDs to map Availability Zones across accounts: Open the AWS Resource Access Manager console.

item.title: CDK
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß Make sure that construct IDs are reproducible. It is recommended to run cdk synth -q twice and compare the generated files.

item.title: Cloud9
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß AWS managed temporary credentials ¬ß Some Cloud9, IAM and STS actions are restricted. See Actions supported by AWS managed temporary credentials.

item.title: CloudTrail
item.description: Usage ¬ß Certain types of CloudTrail events do not associate with related resources. It is recommended to search events with event names, which can be looked up in the Actions page of service API references.

item.title: ECS
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß The awsvpc network mode doesn‚Äôt provide task ENIs with public IP addresses. Therefore, they can‚Äôt make direct use of an internet gateway [and therefore can‚Äôt connect to the internet].

item.title: ELB
item.description: Elastic Load Balancing ¬ß Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß Security groups ¬ß security-group-load-balancer If you‚Äôre using an Application Load Balancer, follow the instructions at Security groups for your Application Load Balancer.

item.title: CLB CloudWatch metrics
item.description: TCP Listener ¬ß SampleCount ¬ß SampleCount of RequestCount and Latency metrics are exactly the same as number of requests. SampleCount of SurgeQueueLength is roughly number of requests doubled.

item.title: NLB
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß You cannot change the health check interval for a target group with the TCP protocol. Quoting AWS Support: When you register a new target to your Network Load Balancer, it is expected to take between 90 and 180 seconds to complete the registration process.

item.title: EMR
item.description: Availability Zones ¬ß Amazon EMR launches all nodes for a given cluster in the same Amazon EC2 Availability Zones. Running a cluster in the same zone improves performance of the jobs flows.

item.title: Graviton Processor

item.title: IAM
item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß iam-increase-policy-size Managed policy limit ¬ß You can assign IAM users to up to 10 groups. You can also attach up to 10 managed policies to each group, for a maximum of 120 policies (20 managed policies attached to the IAM user, 10 IAM groups, with 10 policies each).

item.description: Running an on-demand instance of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) for at least 24 to 48 hours to get access to the Red Hat knowledge base v.a home.

item.description: Private DNS for interface endpoints ¬ß If the private DNS option is enabled, an interface endpoint is created with a hidden private hosted zone attached to the associated VPC.

item.description: Caveats and Gotchas ¬ß If a connection that‚Äôs using a NAT gateway is idle for 350 seconds or more, the connection times out. .

item.description: Asynchronous Search ¬ß consult#asynchronous-search Doom Emacs uses the perl splitting style, which splits the input string at a punctuation character and treats each as an Emacs regular expression, so special characters like $ has to be escaped.

item.description: Run dhall-freeze as early as possible, because dhall-mode re-evaluates the buffer on each change.

item.description: Open URLs ¬ß g f (+lookup/file) works for URLs too. Docsets ¬ß Dash docsets need to be associated with major modes. Most :lang modules have this already.

item.title: Magit
item.description: Navigation ¬ß magit-section-backward-sibling ([) and magit-section-forward-sibling (]). Line-wrap ¬ß $ is mapped to magit-process-buffer, so it‚Äôs hard to jump to end of line.

item.title: ParEdit
item.description: Why doesn‚Äôt Doom package ParEdit? ¬ß From Doom‚Äôs FAQs Why are there no default keybinds for Smartparens (for evil users)? Doom only uses smartparens to manage pair ‚Äúcompletion‚Äù (it does the job better than electric-{pair,quote}-mode or the multitude of other pair-management solutions in the Emacs ecosystem at the time of writing).

item.description: Project-wide actions ¬ß Find file: SPC p f Invalidate cache: SPC p i Save all: SPC p s Project-wide search and replace .

item.title: Straight
item.description: Out of the box, you can install any package listed on MELPA, GNU ELPA, or Emacsmirror, which is to say any package in existence. (Although MELPA is used as a package listing, packages are installed by cloning their Git repositories rather than by downloading tarballs like package.

item.title: Undo

item.title: Vertico
item.description: Key bindings in minibuffer ¬ß Preview: C-SPC for +vertico/embark-preview Next & previous history: M-p and M-n Page up & down: C-S-j and C-S-k Next & previous group: C-M-j and C-M-k Next & previous row: C-j and C-k Exit with input: M-RET (vertico-exit-input) or RET (exit-minibuffer) Search pattern ¬ß Consult Search all key bindings ¬ß Usually SPC h b b, but use C-h b b or <doom-leader-alt-key> instead of SPC when leader key (SPC) is not available, for example in a vertico minibuffer: scroll-up-command <kp-next>, C-S-j vertico-scroll-up <remap> <scroll-up-command> Copy candidate list ¬ß C-; E in minibuffer to export candidates to a new buffer with Embark.

item.title: chinese
item.description: How to Enable ¬ß ;; Uncomment in init.el (doom! :input chinese :ui unicode .

item.title: wgrep
item.description: SPC s p foo C-; E i :%s/././ RET Z Z SPC-s-p foo invokes project-wide search C-; E exports the results into a wgrep buffer i <.

item.title: emacsclient
item.description: Emacs Server on macOS ¬ß <!-- ~/Library/LaunchAgents/gnu.emacs.daemon.plist --> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.

item.title: mu4e
item.description: M-<up>: move to previous message M-<down>: move to next message.

item.title: Prefer Plain Text
item.description: By default, mu4e tries to display the ‚Äôrichest‚Äô option, which is the last MIME-part of the alternatives. You can customize this to prefer the text version, if available, with something like the following in your configuration (and see the docstring for mm-discouraged-alternatives for details) (with-eval-after-load "mm-decode" (add-to-list 'mm-discouraged-alternatives "text/html") (add-to-list 'mm-discouraged-alternatives "text/richtext")) MSGV-Rich_002dtext-and-images.

item.title: CORS Credentials
item.description: The CORS request was attempted with the credentials flag set, but the server is configured using the wildcard (‚Äù*‚Äù) as the value of Access-Control-Allow-Origin, which doesn‚Äôt allow the use of credentials.

item.title: CORS Origin
item.description: Access-Control-Allow-Origin: <origin> Only a single origin can be specified. If the server supports clients from multiple origins, it must return the origin for the specific client making the request.

item.title: HTTP Request RTTs
item.description: Phase 1: DNS Lookup Phase 2: TCP Handshake (1 RTT) Phase 3: TLS Handshake (1 RTT if TLS 1.3) 2 round trips if TLS version < 1.3 Phase 4: HTTP (1 RTT + server-side latency) .

item.title: Preflight Request
item.description: It‚Äôs an OPTIONS request, using three HTTP request headers: Access-Control-Request-Method, Access-Control-Request-Headers, and the Origin header. For example: OPTIONS /resource/foo Access-Control-Request-Method: DELETE Access-Control-Request-Headers: origin, x-requested-with Origin: https://foo.

item.title: 20-20-20 Rule
item.description: Every 20 minutes spent using a screen, you should try to look away at something that is 20 feet away from you for a total of 20 seconds.

item.title: Krita
item.description: Pen Tablet Shortcuts ¬ß Shift + drag left/right to resize the brush. Button (close to pen tip) + drag to zoom in and out. SPACE + drag to move the canvas.

item.title: Fontconfig
item.description: Font directory list ¬ß <dir>/usr/share/fonts</dir> <dir>/usr/X11/lib/X11/fonts</dir> <dir>/opt/local/share/fonts</dir> <dir>/Library/Fonts</dir> <dir>/Network/Library/Fonts</dir> <dir>/System/Library/Fonts</dir> <dir prefix="xdg">fonts</dir> <!-- the following element will be removed in the future --> <dir>~/.

item.title: Ideas
item.description: Improvements ¬ß Fix port bump in ports with multiple checksums (e.g. cargo.crates). port command blocks on DNS resolution timeout, and is impossible to interrupt safely.

item.title: Alternative Compiler
item.description: Beware of MP_PATH_SCAN. dnl This macro ensures MP installation prefix paths are NOT in PATH dnl for configure to prevent potential problems when base/ code is updated dnl and ports are installed that would match needed items.

item.title: Anatomy
item.description: Database ¬ß /* ports table */ "CREATE TABLE registry.ports (" "id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY" // row ID ", name TEXT COLLATE NOCASE" // name of the port ", portfile TEXT" // path of Portfile copy ", location TEXT" // image (binary archive) location ", epoch INTEGER" // part of version comparison ", version TEXT COLLATE VERSION" // part of version comparison ", revision INTEGER" // part of version comparison ", variants TEXT" // actual variants used to build port ", requested_variants TEXT" // variants explicitly requested by user ", state TEXT" // installed (activated) or imaged (has image) ", date DATETIME" // install date ", installtype TEXT" // unused, always "image" ", archs TEXT" // list of architectures of this port ", requested INTEGER" // is port requested (boolean) ", os_platform TEXT" // operating system (e.

item.title: Registry
item.description: registry2 package is entirely written in C. Tcl_PkgProvide(interp, "registry2", "2.0") registry2.0/registry.tcl provides registry 1.

item.title: Tcl API
item.description: Tcl_GetIndexFromObjStruct ¬ß Simple static dictionary lookup. // Array of `struct` type, whose first member is a null-terminated string. // End of array is marked by a NULL string pointer.

item.title: SNMPv2 TCP Statistics
item.description: Source: RFC 2012 ObjectDescriptionRtoAlgorithmThe algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets.RtoMinThe minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds.

item.title: Nginx
item.description: Nginx is a high-performance Web server, mostly used to serve HTTP requests. location Byte-Range Request Proxy Headers Health Check Upstream Keepalive .

item.title: Byte-Range Request
item.description: Nginx will try to slice the response body when one of the following conditions is met and the request specifies a Range header. Nginx is serving static files directly.

item.title: Nginx Thundering Herd Problem
item.description: Solution 1: EPOLLEXCLUSIVE flag ¬ß If EPOLLEXCLUSIVE (Linux 4.5, glibc 2.24) is defined when compiling Nginx, Nginx could make use of it to reduce resource usage when volume of new connection is low.

item.title: location
item.description: proxy_pass redirecting ¬ß If a prefix-matching location ends with a slash (/), and requests are processed by proxy_pass, requests to the exact string minus the trailing slash will be redirected to full URI (domain included) with slash appended.

item.title: Headers
item.description: The default set of headers passed to upstream is defined in ngx_http_proxy_headers. static ngx_keyval_t ngx_http_proxy_headers[] = { { ngx_string("Host"), ngx_string("$proxy_host") }, { ngx_string("Connection"), ngx_string("close") }, { ngx_string("Content-Length"), ngx_string("$proxy_internal_body_length") }, { ngx_string("Transfer-Encoding"), ngx_string("$proxy_internal_chunked") }, { ngx_string("TE"), ngx_string("") }, { ngx_string("Keep-Alive"), ngx_string("") }, { ngx_string("Expect"), ngx_string("") }, { ngx_string("Upgrade"), ngx_string("") }, { ngx_null_string, ngx_null_string } };.

item.title: Health Check
item.description: If Nginx upstream points at a load balancer and overloading is not of concern, you can set max_fails to 0 to disable passive health checks.

item.title: Keepalive
item.description: To enable keepalive connections to upstream, the keepalive directive must be included in upstream{} blocks, and in the location{} blocks you need to switch HTTP version to 1.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: Setup ¬ß Assign Cmd+; hotkey to ‚ÄúTemplate: Insert template‚Äù. In Files & Links, use absolute path in vault for new links. Routine ¬ß Create a note by linking to it first and then press Cmd+Enter to follow the link.

item.title: FreeBSD
item.description: Features ¬ß DTrace .

item.title: DTrace
item.description: One-Liners and Scripts ¬ß One-Liners Capture Stacks ¬ß For use with Flame Graph. # Capture user-level stack at 197 Hz for 60 seconds sudo dtrace -x ustackframes=100 -n 'profile-197 /execname == "python3.

item.title: ps
item.description: Process Tree ¬ß -d arranges processes into a tree representing parent and child relationships. ps aux -d.

item.title: BBR
item.description: Configuration ¬ß Only sysctl net.ipv4.tcp_congestion_control is needed since Linux 4.13. Just a quick announcement that Eric Dumazet has checked in a nice feature in Linux 4.

item.title: FirewallD Specify Zone by IP Address
item.description: Warning Make sure to add services from the previous zone before adding IP to the new zone. firewall-cmd --new-zone=minecraft-access --permanent firewall-cmd --zone=minecraft-access --add-service=ssh --permanent firewall-cmd --zone=minecraft-access --add-source=a.

item.title: TCP Kernel Parameters
item.description: net.ipv4.tcp_congestion_control ¬ß See BBR. net.ipv4.tcp_rmem ¬ß Contains three values that represent the minimum, default and maximum size of the TCP socket receive buffer.

item.title: epoll
item.description: EPOLLEXCLUSIVE Flag ¬ß Limitations ¬ß The following values may be specified in conjunction with EPOLLEXCLUSIVE: EPOLLIN, EPOLLOUT, EPOLLWAKEUP, and EPOLLET.

item.title: WiFi
item.description: Client mode ¬ß config wifi-iface 'wifinet1' option device 'radio0' option mode 'sta' option ssid 'AP_SSID' option encryption 'psk2' option bssid 'xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' option key 'xxxxxxxx' option network 'wan' Don‚Äôt use AP+STA on one physical radio without travelmate.

item.title: KeyChain in CLI Tools
item.description: Email ¬ß mbsync (isync) ¬ß UseKeychain yes Add the above to mbsync configuration and create the keychain item with: security add-internet-password -r imap -s Host -a User -w msmtp ¬ß Use the exact host and user configured in .

item.title: Programming
item.description: Programming is the process of creating software.

item.title: Compile Database
item.description: Database Generation ¬ß CMake ¬ß cmake -DCMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS=On .

item.title: Flame Graph
item.description: FlameGraph Graph Variants ¬ß --reverse stack-reversed flame graph --inverted icicle graph (top to bottom, ) .

item.title: Code Coverage
item.description: llvm-cov gcov ¬ß Once you have generated the coverage data files, run llvm-cov gcov for each main source file where you want to examine the coverage results.

item.title: benchstat
item.description: Compare go test -bench=.

item.title: Module Search Path
item.description: sys.path is initialized from these locations: The directory containing the input script (or the current directory when no file is specified). PYTHONPATH (a list of directory names, with the same syntax as the shell variable PATH).

item.title: SRE
item.description: Definition ¬ß SRE is what happens when you ask a software engineer to design an ops team. We want systems that runs and repairs itself: automatic, not just automated.

item.title: Alerting
item.description: Software should do the interpreting of the alerting domain, and humans should be notified when action is needed. There are three kinds of valid monitoring output: Alerts (paging): immediate action needed Tickets and email alerts: action needed, but not immediately Logging: recorded for diagnostic or forensic purposes Paging a human is a quite expensive use of an employee‚Äôs time.

item.title: Blameless Culture
item.description: Definition ¬ß Blameless culture means Focus on identifying the contributing causes of the incident without indicating any individual or team for bad or inappropriate behavior.

item.title: Capacity Planning
item.description: SRE ultimately controls provisioning. We provision to meet a capacity target at a specific response speed, thus we are keenly interested in a service‚Äôs performance.

item.title: Change Management
item.description: Roughly 70% of outages are due to changes in a live system. Trio of practices ¬ß Implementing progressive rollouts Quickly and accurately detecting problems Rolling back changes safely when problems arise Automation ¬ß Remove humans from the loop, use automation.

item.title: Eliminating Toil
item.description: Toil TODO: eliminating-toil 50% Cap ¬ß ‚ÄúOps‚Äù work like tickets, on-call should be capped to below 50% of each SRE‚Äôs time. This ensures a focus on the engineering aspect of SRE.

item.title: Emergency Response
item.description: Playbooks ¬ß Humans add latency, so thinking through and recording the best practices ahead of time in a ‚Äúplaybook‚Äù. It‚Äôs also a substitute for smart engineers able to think on the fly, and helps response to a high-stakes or time-sensitive page.

item.title: Error Budget
item.description: Purpose ¬ß Error budgets resolve the structural conflict of incentives between development and SRE. If product development wants to skimp on testing or increase push velocity and SRE is resistant, the error budget guides the decision.

item.title: Managing Incidents
item.description: Recursive Separation of Responsibilities ¬ß A role leader might delegate system components to colleagues, who report high-level information back up to the leaders.

item.title: Managing Service Risk
item.description: With risk conceptualized as a (nonlinear) continuum, we need to determine where to place individual services on the continuum. We give equal importance to Figure out how to engineer great reliability into our systems.

item.title: Mandatory Review
item.description: All proposed changes (CLs) should be reviewed before being submitted.

item.title: Measuring Service Risk
item.description: The traditional way of measuring unplanned downtime is not suitable for geo-distributed Internet services, because a given service is at least partially ‚Äúup‚Äù at all times.

item.title: Monitoring
item.description: The Four Golden Signals ¬ß Latency It‚Äôs important to distinguish between the latency of successful requests and the latency of failed requests. Should we cout client timeouts as successful requests? They are potentially requests that took too long but could have been successful, on the other hand it could also be a client-side early close.

item.title: On-Call
item.description: Best Practice ¬ß Google recommends a maximum of two events per 8-12-hour on-call shift to have adequate time to handle the event accurately and quickly.

item.title: Postmortem
item.description: Criteria ¬ß It is important to define postmortem criteria before an incident occurs so that everyone knows when a postmortem is necessary. Blameless Culture ¬ß Importance of the blameless culture when conducting a postmortem can not be overstated.

item.title: Prodtest
item.description: Prodtest extent a unit test framework to allow for unit testing of real-world services. Any time a team encountered a delay due to anthoer team‚Äôs unexpected misconfiguration, a bug could be filed to extend their Prodtest.

item.title: SLO
item.description: Purpose ¬ß Managing Service Risk SLOs should be a major driver in prioritizing work for SREs and product developers, because they reflect what users care about.

item.title: Service Level Indicator
item.description: Be Realistic ¬ß Sometimes only a proxy is available. For example, client-side latency is often the more user-relevant metric, but it might only be possible to measure latency at the server.

item.title: Toil
item.description: Definition ¬ß Toil is the kind of work tied to running a production service that tends to be manual, repetitive, automatable, tactical, devoid of enduring value, and that scales linearly as a service grows.

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: Monitoring, logging and exposing current state are the three tricks for troubleshooting. It‚Äôs really useful to have multiple verbosity levels available, along with a way to increase these levels on the fly.

item.title: Irssi Config
item.description: Pin Self-signed Certificate ¬ß /set use_tls yes /set tls_verify no /set tls_pinned_cert "XX:XX:.

item.title: Netdata
item.description: Disable Telemetry and Cloud Features ¬ß cat > ~/cloud.conf << EOF [global] enabled = no EOF sudo cp ~/cloud.conf /var/lib/netdata/cloud.d/ sudo touch /etc/netdata/.

item.title: WeeChat Config
item.description: ZNC Multi-Connect and CertFP ¬ß Connect to multiple networks by specifying network name in username in username/networkname format. /server add networkname IP/port -ssl -username=username/networkname -password=x -autoconnect /set irc.

item.title: ZNC
item.description: CertFP with Server ¬ß One certificate per user only. Make sure you have a backup before updating it from Web UI. Cert CertFP with Client ¬ß Chat with *certauth to manage keys.

item.title: Taking Notes
item.description: Organizing Notes ¬ß Capture ideas on the go with Tana Capture. Turn them into organized fleet notes. Keep a private journal for complex tasks. Nurture evergreen notes from fleet notes and journals.

item.title: Twitter
item.description: uBlock Origin rules ¬ß ! Discover more / More Tweets - Conversation view suggestions twitter.com##[aria-label="Timeline: Conversation"] [data-testid="cellInnerDiv"] h2:has-text(/^(Discover more|More Tweets)$/):upward([data-testid="cellInnerDiv"]) twitter.
